definition: the Chinese People's Volunteer Army deployed by China to aid North Korea in 1950
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 ren2 min2 zhi4 yuan4 jun1

sentences.english: Volunteers were in the bush all the time and didn't let on.
sentences.chinese: 志愿军战士们一直在灌木丛中，没有暴露目标。

sentences.english: For the purpose of fighting against the foreign invasion, they organized spontaneously an army composed of volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 为了抗击外国的侵略，他们自发组成志愿军。

sentences.english: Wang Cheng is an outstanding representative of Chinese people's volunteer army.
sentences.chinese: 王成是中国人民志愿军的杰出代表。

sentences.english: The Volunteers were in the bush all the time and didn't let on.
sentences.chinese: 志愿军战士们一直在灌木丛中，没有暴露目标。

sentences.english: But the personnel share will grow as the Ministry of National Defense implements the all-volunteer army.
sentences.chinese: 随着国防总部实施全志愿军政策，人员的数量增加了。

sentences.english: At 23 he became brigadier general of volunteers in command of a Michigan cavalry brigade.
sentences.chinese: 23岁时他被任命为志愿军一个骑兵旅的准将。

definition: the Chinese People's Volunteer Army deployed by China to aid North Korea in 1950
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 ren2 min2 zhi4 yuan4 jun1

definition: Resist US, help North Korea (1950s slogan)
Eighth Route Army, the larger of the two major Chinese communist forces fighting the Japanese in the Second Sino-Japanese War (1937-1945)
Shanganling district of Yichun city 伊春市[Yi1 chun1 shi4], Heilongjiang

Peng Dehuai (1898-1974), top communist general, subsequently politician and politburo member, disgraced after attacking Mao's failed policies in 1959, and died after extensive persecution during the Cultural Revolution
Liaoshen Campaign (Sep-Nov 1948), the first of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War
New Fourth army of Republic of China, set up in 1937 and controlled by the communists
War of Liberation (1945-49), after which the Communists 共產黨武裝|共产党武装 under Mao Zedong 毛澤東|毛泽东 took over from the Nationalists 國民政府|国民政府 under Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石
Huaihai Campaign (Nov 1948-Jan 1949), one of the three major campaigns by the People's Liberation Army near the end of the Chinese Civil War, considered the determining battle of the war
